sen.e: In December, Emperor Reizei visited Oharano, and Tamakazura joined the party, too.

sen.e: Tamakazura saw her father, Tono Chujo (the first secretary's captain), for the first time, but she was more fascinated by the beauty of Emperor Reizei, who looked exactly like Genji.

sen.j: そんな心中を見透かしたように、源氏は玉鬘に内侍司としての出仕を勧めた。
sen.e: Genji recommended Tamakazura's serving as Naishi no Tsukasa, as if he had seen through her heart.

sen.j: 源氏は玉鬘の裳着を急ぐかたわら、実父内大臣に腰結いの役を頼む。
sen.e: While Genji prepared for Tamakazura's Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls) in a hurry, he asked her biological father, Minister of the Palace, to take the place of koshi-yui (a person who tie a band around a young woman's waist for her coming-of-age ceremony).

sen.e: Minister of the Palace, however, did not know the truth, and he turned it down on the pretext of the sick of his mother, Omiya.

sen.j: そこで源氏は自ら大宮の見舞いに参上し、大宮とやってきた内大臣に玉鬘の素性を明かした。
sen.e: So Genji visited Omiya on his own initiative, and he confessed to her and Minister of the Palace who Tamakazura was.

sen.e: Minister of the Palace were willing to take the role of koshi-yui this time, and on the day of Mogi, the parent and daughter finally met each other.

sen.j: やがて事の次第が世間にも漏れ、近江の君は玉鬘ばかりが誰からも大切にされるのを羨んで、ますます周囲にからかわれた。
sen.e: Before long, people got to know the truth, and Omi no Kimi was made fun of more than ever because she envied Tamakazura, who was cherished by everybody.
